alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 4:58PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF PIKE COUNTY... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This squall is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 457 PM EST, a snow squall was over Virgie, or 9 miles southwest of Pikeville moving east at 25 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Rockhouse, Jonancy, Lookout, Dorton, Marrowbone and Ashcamp around 505 PM EST. Cedarville and Belcher around 510 PM EST. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 3 and 14. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
